subs.text: @AlainLe89396509 Who marketed Chromebooks with a USP as “lower price”, retailers? Maybe. But that isn’t, nor was it ever, a USP. In the beginning, you paid less because you had less capability and functionality. Chrome OS has always been about 3 S’s: Speed, Simplicity, Security. *That’s* the USP.
subs.rawText: @AlainLe89396509 Who marketed Chromebooks with a USP as “lower price”, retailers? Maybe. But that isn’t, nor was it ever, a USP. In the beginning, you paid less because you had less capability and functionality. Chrome OS has always been about 3 S’s: Speed, Simplicity, Security. *That’s* the USP.

subs.text: @AlainLe89396509 Also for reference: The Windows version of the HP Elite Dragonfly is about $1,000 to $1,500 more than this HP Elite Dragonfly Chromebook. Mainly because they’re targeted at enterprise. [link]
subs.rawText: @AlainLe89396509 Also for reference: The Windows version of the HP Elite Dragonfly is about $1,000 to $1,500 more than this HP Elite Dragonfly Chromebook. Mainly because they’re targeted at enterprise. https://t.co/3ukTTXS2J8

subs.text: @AlainLe89396509 You can still buy a $200 - $300 (or less with sales) Chromebook. But these were never about “being cheap”. That’s a myth based on the first Chromebooks using repurposed netbook hardware. Chrome OS devices also run Android apps and a full Linux install, so not all web based.
subs.rawText: @AlainLe89396509 You can still buy a $200 - $300 (or less with sales) Chromebook. But these were never about “being cheap”. That’s a myth based on the first Chromebooks using repurposed netbook hardware. Chrome OS devices also run Android apps and a full Linux install, so not all web based.

subs.text: @AlainLe89396509 There are Chromebooks at nearly every budget / price point. And the internals of a Chromebook can be the same as a Windows laptop; parts cost the same, regardless of the operating system.
subs.rawText: @AlainLe89396509 There are Chromebooks at nearly every budget / price point. And the internals of a Chromebook can be the same as a Windows laptop; parts cost the same, regardless of the operating system.

subs.text: @Angry_Staffer Is there really any true effort to kill the filibuster? There’s risk involved since the minority may gain a congressional majority but at this point, it seems that it’s the only way to get any forward movement.
